Description: A military court in St. Petersburg sentenced a Ukrainian to 15 years for arson of a military registration and enlistment office1 The Western District Military Court in St. Petersburg sentenced Pyotr Romanyuk, a native of Ukraine, to 15 years in prison for attempting to arson a military registration and enlistment office in the Karelian city of Suoyarvi, reports the Karelian publication From Karelia with freedom.Romanyuk was found guilty under Article 205 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (-Terrorist attack-). Description: -Dismantling the Kyiv regime- can be proposed by Russia at the negotiations, - The Washington Post-An influential Moscow think tank, closely associated with the Russian FSB,- has prepared a document with maximalist demands aimed at achieving Moscow‚Äôs strategic goals in the Ukrainian conflict, writes The Washington Post. According to the publication, the document was prepared in February, a week before the negotiations between Russia and the USA, held on February 18 in Riyadh in Saudi Arabia.According to information received by journalists from European intelligence sources, the document proposals from the administration of US President Donald Trump to end the war in Ukraine within 100 days, as well as plans to send peacekeepers to the region, are rejected. Instead, it is argued that -a peaceful resolution of the Ukrainian crisis cannot occur until 2026.-The authors of the document insist on official recognition of Russian sovereignty over the occupied territories of Ukraine. In addition, it is proposed to create a buffer zone in the north-east of Ukraine, adjacent to the Bryansk and Belgorod regions of Russia, as well as a demilitarized zone in the south of Ukraine, which will also affect the Odessa region.The document also contains a demand for the -complete dismantling- of the current Ukrainian government, since the authors believe that -the current Kiev regime cannot be changed from within the country.- In addition, there is disagreement with maintaining the size of the Ukrainian army at the current level and with the continued supply of American weapons to Ukraine after a possible peace agreement.The document emphasizes the need to normalize relations between Washington and Moscow by restoring the full diplomatic staff of embassies. It is proposed to appoint Alexander Darchiev as Ambassador of the Russian Federation to the United States, which, according to the authors, should help improve bilateral relations.As for the sanctions imposed against Russia, the authors of the document believe that their significance is -clearly exaggerated- and reject attempts to involve Russia in a peace agreement through partial lifting of sanctions. They argue that -it is unclear what Russia would benefit from- such an approach.Russian Presidential spokesman Dmitry Peskov told The Washington Post that the Kremlin was -not aware of such recommendations- and called them -extremely contradictory.- -We are working with more thoughtful options,- said Peskov.At the same time, as the publication notes, some of the proposals presented in the document have already been put forward by the Russian authorities. In particular, Russia offered the US access to its mineral resources, including in the occupied territories of Ukraine, and also advocated for the restoration of the staff of diplomats in the embassies of the two countries. Both of these proposals were in the document.

Title: üñº A Yalta resident was sentenced to 24 years in prison in the ca...
Description: Yalta resident was sentenced to 24 years in prison in the case of the assassination attempt on Oleg TsarevIn the annexed Crimea, 47-year-old Yalta resident Pyotr Zhitsky was sentenced to 24 years in prison. The Southern District Military Court found him guilty of the attempt on the life of former deputy of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine Oleg Tsarev. The court also imposed a fine on him in the amount of 800 thousand rubles, the press service of the court reports.Zhitsky was found guilty of six criminal articles at once, including high treason, preparation of a terrorist act, attempt on the life of a public figure, illegal storage and manufacture of explosives, as well as illegal trafficking in weapons. According to the verdict, he will spend the first five years in prison, and the remaining term in a maximum security colony.The FSB states that since the beginning of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the Security Service of Ukraine allegedly created an underground network in Crimea, the purpose of which was to attack pro-Russian officials and public figures. According to investigators, Zhitsky came into contact with representatives of the SBU and began to transmit information to them.In November 2022, the court claims, he received the coordinates of a cache that contained weapons and explosives, after which he took them and made an improvised explosive device. From December to October he monitored Tsarev, and in the spring of 2023 he chose a place for an attack. The attack occurred in the fall on the territory of the Kirov sanatorium in Yalta. Tsarev survived.Tsarev was a deputy of the Verkhovna Rada from 2002 to 2014. After the start of the war in Donbass, he went over to the side of the separatists and became the speaker of the -parliament of Novorossiya-. In Kyiv, Tsarev was sentenced in absentia to 12 years in prison on charges of encroaching on the territorial integrity of the country and calling for the overthrow of the state system.

Title: üñº The ex-President of the Philippines was detained on an ICC war...
Description: Former President of the Philippines was detained on an ICC warrantFormer President of the Philippines, 79-year-old Rodrigo Duterte, was detained at Manila International Airport on a warrant from the International Criminal Court (ICC). The arrest is related to charges of crimes against humanity committed during his anti-drug campaign, reports the Associated Press. According to human rights activists, more than 12 thousand people were killed in anti-drug operations during Duterte's presidency from 2016 to 2022. In 2019, Duterte removed the Philippines from the jurisdiction of the Rome Statute, under which the ICC operates, so Duterte's lawyer, Salvador Panelo, called the arrest illegal. However, the court stated that it had jurisdiction over crimes committed up to that point - from November 1, 2011 to March 16, 2019 inclusive. The detainee's daughter, Sara Duterte, is the vice president of the Philippines. President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., who succeeded Duterte as president in 2022, has stated his readiness to cooperate with the ICC on issues related to the arrest. It is currently unknown where Duterte is being held after his arrest and when he will be brought to Europe to be transferred to the ICC.

Description: A 101-year-old general was detained in Romania for suspicion of plotting a coup and having ties with RussiaAbout this reportedThe Directorate for Investigation of Organized Crime and Terrorism (DIICOT). Among the six detainees is 101-year-old retired Major General Radu Theodoro, a World War II veteran and one of the leaders of the Vlad the Impaler Team. According to the investigation, in 2023, five of the detainees created an organized criminal group with the aim of undermining the sovereignty and independence of Romania by weakening its defense capabilities. In 2024, another person joined them.The group called for Romania's withdrawal from NATO, the restoration of economic and cultural ties with Russia, China and Iran, as well as the creation of a new leadership structure for the country. The investigation claims that the suspects repeatedly came into contact with agents of foreign states, both in Romania and in Russia. In particular, in January 2025, two of them visited Moscow, where they met with unnamed people who expressed their willingness to support their efforts to seize state power in Romania. Romanian Intelligence Service (SRI) statedthat members of the group actively sought support from employees of the Russian embassy in Bucharest. As a result, two Russian diplomats were declared persona non grata and expelled from the country. On March 5, searches took place in Bucharest and three counties of Romania, during which evidence of collusion was seized. Prosecutors are asking for the arrest of four defendants and house arrest for two more. The names of the detainees have not been officially disclosed. Radu Teodorou, despite his advanced age, actively supported Calin Georgescu, the Romanian presidential candidate in the November 2024 elections. Georgescu, known for his criticism of the European Union and NATO, as well as positive comments about the Russian president, denies allegations of ties to Russia. In February, he was detained for questioning on charges of participation in a fascist organization. In November 2024, presidential elections were held in Romania, in the first round which Georgescu defeated. However, the country's Constitutional Court annulled the voting results due to reports of irregularities. New elections are scheduled for May 2025.

Title: üñºThe South Korean President was released from custody. The Seoul...
Description: South Korean President released from custodyThe Seoul Central District Court ordered the release of suspended South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol from custody, where he had been held for more than a month after being arrested and charged in connection with the imposition of martial law, Yonhap Agency reports. The court granted Yoon's request for release, recognizing that his term formal arrest expired before charges were filed in late January. In addition, the court noted that the investigative agency that detained Yoon before his official arrest did not have the legal authority to investigate the sedition charges. Yoon Seok Yeol was arrested on January 19 on suspicion of rebellion following the imposition of martial law on December 3, 2024. This made him the first sitting president of modern South Korea to be placed under arrest. Martial law, which included a ban on political parties, protests, strikes, the suspension of parliament, the introduction of censorship and field tribunals, was lifted about six hours after the parliament vote. Yoon is suspected of being orderedtroops to arrest members of parliament to prevent the repeal of his martial law decree. Lawmakers voted to lift martial law as the military attempted to seize parliament. If Yoon is found guilty of sedition, he faces the death penalty or life imprisonment. Yoon's impeachment is currently being considered by the Constitutional Court. If the impeachment is confirmed, Yoon will be formally removed from office and national elections will be held within two months to elect his successor. The court's decision is expected soon.

Social activists suspect man-made discharges from Norilsk Nickel factories and minesIn Norilsk, water has been leaking onto the road to the airport for more than a month, despite frosts down to -40‚Äì45 degrees. Social activists believe that this is not a natural phenomenon, but a discharge of technical water from Norilsk Nickel factories and mines. They contacted Rosprirodnadzor and the prosecutor's office, stating that at this temperature the water should have frozen, but this does not happen, which may indicate its man-made origin.-The continuous spill of water creates a dangerous situation on the road, the man-made nature of the water can lead to harm to the life and health of citizens, and harm the environment,- says a letter from the public organization -My Home- in Norilsk,- transmits -Siberian Express-. Norilsk Nickel explains the problem by natural processes and terrain features, due to which water flows down to the highway. The company sent equipment to remove the ice and clean the culvert, but the situation has still not been resolved. Chairman of the organization -My Home- in Norilsk Ruslan Abdullaev compared what was happening with the fuel spill in Taimyr in 2020 and believes that the authorities should introduce a state of emergency at least at the local level in order to understand in detail the causes of the leak. In the meantime, according to him, Norilsk Nickel is simply clearing the way, but not solving the problem itself.

Description: A criminal case was opened against the Russian actor Gleb Kalyuzhny for evading military serviceThis was reported by RIA Novosti and Kommersant with reference to sources.According to their information, Kalyuzhny voluntarily came to a single conscription point for military service in October 2024. There he was given a summons to appear at the assembly point, from where conscripts are sent to military units. The actor did not show up on the summons. The maximum punishment under the article he is charged with (Part 1 of Article 328 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation) is imprisonment for up to two years.The 26-year-old actor is known for his roles in the TV series -Vampires of the Middle Band- and -Difficult Teenagers.-
